and IIId are thought to lead to the production of an enzyme with reduced function. All AGL gene mutations lead to storage of abnormal, partially broken down glycogen molecules within cells. A buildup of abnormal glycogen damages organs and tissues throughout the body, particularly the liver and muscles, leading to the signs and symptoms of GSDIII.",GHR,glycogen storage disease type III
Is glycogen storage disease type III inherited ?,"This condition is inherited in an autosomal recessive pattern
